channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2023111263
item.description:
Report X-2023111263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and soiled near the taggers on bank 3 of the RORS unload. Package had a Corrosive 8 labeling (UN1824) and was immediately taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the staff. Package was a fully regulated HazMat. Package was unloaded from facility 608. DescribePack: The one plastic bottle inside had its cap bent severely to the side. This compromised the item and the seal underneath, which allowed for liquid to begin leaking from the bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023110858
item.description:
Report X-2023110858

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. LIQUID GOT ON AN EMPLOYEE WHO WAS GIVEN FIRST AID. SPILLAGE ABSORBED AND PACKAGE CONTAINED IN HAZBAG AND BROUGHT TO HAZMAT AREA FOR INSPECTION. INNER JERRICAN WAS LEAKING FROM CAP, WHICH WAS TIGHTLY CLOSED BUT APPEARED TO HAVE A DEFECT AT SEAM/PLACE OF JOINING JERRICAN. DescribePack: INNER JERRICAN WAS LEAKING FROM CAP, WHICH WAS TIGHTLY CLOSED BUT APPEARED TO HAVE A DEFECT AT SEAM/PLACE OF JOINING JERRICAN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILLAGE ABSORBED. PACKAGE CONTAINED IN HAZBAG AND BROUGHT TO HAZMAT AREA FOR INSPECTION.

item.title: Report E-2023110273
item.description:
Report E-2023110273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: S CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During transit, a 275-gallon tote containing UN1197-Caramel Liquid Flavoring was punctured resulting in a 1-cup release onto the concrete dock floor, once off-loaded. A contractor cleaned the release and performed a tote transfer. No storm drains, soil, or waterways were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2023110506
item.description:
Report E-2023110506

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: MELROSE PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN2014 was punctured and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the wood bleaching kit-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat spill was reported over the walkie. QA then got PPE and absorbent and cleaned up spill. Placed package on cart and brought to hazmat cage. Opened up package and saw 1 bottle and 1 cap came off causing internal leakage. item.title: Report E-2023110333
item.description:
Report E-2023110333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported 0.5-gal release of (UN1866) CS-309-25 OTC on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and proper PPE. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 30gal metal drum in the facilities waste area, it was left for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-pint of Acetone (UN1090) was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal USA. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3151563. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 55-gallon DM contains twelve 1-gallon metal pails of Acetone and Oil Dri, the waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110328
item.description:
Report E-2023110328

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: AURORA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported there was a release of UN1760 "TEMP DET" that arrived damaged at Terminal XAU. (1) five-gallon plastic pails were damaged due to not being properly secured to their pallets impacting Trailer #465-0086, and was starting to leak through the trailer. Due to the corrosive nature, of the material a contractor was dispatched to the terminal to complete the cleanup activity. Terminal personnel placed absorbent material underneath the trailer to contain any impact. Citrix acid was used to neutralize the impacted area. The team then swept in oil dri and collecting which created (1) 55-gallon DF filled with (1) 5-gallon pail /waste and (1) 40-gallon DF filled with/ Impacted oil dri and cardboard/waste. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

Paint clip came off and lid popped open causing leakage. 2nd can covered in paint and also dented on body and rim with no leakage. Package shows no LQ diamond in spidr. item.title: Report E-2023110154
item.description:
Report E-2023110154

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, eight (8) one-gallon jugs of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3264-impacted impacted trailer and concrete pavement. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. ES+ personnel solidified the damaged jugs of product. The damaged jugs and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was pumping into his trailer when hose came disconnected allowing approximately 2 gallons of solvent to be released onto the containment pad. It was determined the driver failed to completely lock down the hose to the coupling. The solvent was immediately collected and returned to the tank. The solvent that had to wiped up with absorbent material was disposed of in the appropriate containers and will be transported for disposal following all required regulation.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 23, 2023, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the damage of approximately (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II) was punctured, with NO release seen. They were able to transfer the contents of the drum into a new 65-gallon poly overpack without complication. The 65-gallon poly overpack containerized waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

Report E-2023110053

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 3 cups of Air Con Spa-2500 FC (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor at door 184. The terminal advised they had already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged drum, and oil dri was placed into a 20-gallon metal drum lined with plastic and staged in OS&D. The contractor transferred the waste to a proper poly drum and left 2 85-gallon poly drums on site for the terminal. The waste that was staged was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110030

Report E-2023110030

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Spartan BLD (laundry detergent) (UN1760 - corrosive) was released from (1) 5-gallon bucket due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The impacted pail was containerized by the contractors into 1-55 gal df and containerized all spent absorbents, PPE and wood chips into a separate 55 gal df. The impacted trailer floor was neutralized with a vinegar and water solution. The remainder of the pails were restacked. Waste was left onsite for the Terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023101514
item.description:
Report X-2023101514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: BEDFORD PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER APPROACHED THE LEAKER ON THE SORT AISLE WITH FULL PPE DECISION TREE ON HAND. THERE WERE NO OUTER MARKINGS TO INDICATE WHAT IT MAY BE SO RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE UNKNOWN RESPONSE SHEET, WHICH LED TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. ONCE THE LEAKER WAS CONTAINED, RESPONDER BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX WAS ABLE TO IDENTIFY "ZAP DRAIN PIPE OPENER." SULFURIC ACID PG 11 UN1830.
